data: A large rectangular block, uneven behind, presumably forming part of a terracing wall. The upper right corner is lost, and the lower right corner has been broken from the left half, but is preserved.
The text is set out over two columns across the face of the block.
second or earlier first century BCE
Found in 1833 along with 3 other blocks; subsequently transported to Messina; now in the theatre antiquarium
I.Sicily with the permission of the Assessorato Regionale dei Beni Culturali e dell’Identità Siciliana - Dipartimento dei Beni Culturali e dell’Identità Siciliana; photo 2009-10-16.
The collection in the "Casina degli Inglesi" consists of 20 inscriptions, 1 statue, two busts, a few mosaics, a 2nd C AD marble sarcophagus and some modern art
Johann Franz, «Iscrizioni taormitane», Annali dell’Instituto di corrispondenza archeologica 10, fasc. 1 (1838): 65–79
Inscriptiones Graecae Siciliae et Italiae, additis graecis Galliae Hispaniae, Britanniae, Germaniae inscriptionibus

G. Kaibel, Inscriptiones Graecae Siciliae et Italiae, Additis Graecis Galliae Hispaniae, Britanniae, Germaniae Inscriptionibus, Inscriptiones Graecae Consilio et Auctoritate Academiae Litterarum Regiae Borussicae Editae. Volumen XIV., XIV (Berlin: Georgius Reimerus, 1890)
Inscriptiones graecae Siciliae et infimae Italiae ad ius pertinentes
V. Arangio Ruiz and A. Olivieri, Inscriptiones graecae Siciliae et infimae Italiae ad ius pertinentes (Milan, 1925)
F. Bechtel et al., Sammlung der griechischen Dialekt-Inschriften, 4 vols (Göttingen: Vandenhoeck and Ruprecht, 1884)
A. Boeckh et al., Corpus Inscriptionum Graecarum, 4 vols (Berlin: Ex Officina Academica, 1828)

Giacomo Manganaro, «Le tavole finanziare di Tauromenion», in Comptes et inventaires dans la cité grecque: actes du colloque international d’épigraphique tenu à Neuchâtel du 23 au 26 septembre 1986 en l’honneur de J.Tréheux, a c. di D. Knoepfler (Neuchâtel, 1988), 155–90
Arangio Ruiz and Olivieri, 1925, Inscriptiones graecae Siciliae et infimae Italiae ad ius pertinentes
Manganaro, 1988, Le tavole finanziare di Tauromenion

Italy Sicily Taormina Antiquarium del Teatro Antico Ancient Greek

A large rectangular block, uneven behind, presumably forming part of a terracing wall. The upper right corner is lost, and the lower right corner has been broken from the left half, but is preserved.

limestone block 34.5 62.5 34

The text is set out over two columns across the face of the block.

chiselled Line 1 Interlineation line 1 to 2 Tauromenium Taormina 37.85358, 15.28851 second or earlier first century BCE Found in 1833 along with 3 other blocks; subsequently transported to Messina; now in the theatre antiquarium 2009.10.06
